intro: Erigeron koraginensis, commonly known as the Koragin's fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the central and western regions of the United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces daisy-like flowers with white petals and yellow centers, which bloom in the summer months. Erigeron koraginensis is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in ecological succession.
